traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the {NAME} or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes {1d10} fire damage.

traits.name: Improved Critical
traits.description: The {NAME}'s attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

traits.name: Superior Critical
traits.description: The {NAME}'s attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

traits.name: Great Weapon Fighting
traits.description: When the {NAME} rolls a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack made with a melee weapon wielded with two hands, it can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for the {NAME} to gain this benefit.

traits.name: Protection
traits.description: When a creature the {NAME} can see attacks a target other than the {NAME} that is within 5 feet of it, the {NAME} can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. The {NAME} must be wielding a shield to use this trait.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The {NAME} regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the {NAME} takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the {NAME}'s next turn. The {NAME} dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The {NAME} has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the {NAME}'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the {NAME} has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The {NAME} can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.description: While underwater, the {NAME} is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the {NAME} or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {DC:CON} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the {NAME}, the {NAME} learns the creature's greatest desires if the {NAME} can see the creature.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance
traits.description: If the {NAME} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the {NAME} and the two of them can see each other, the {NAME} can force the creature to make a {DC:CON} Constitution saving throw if the {NAME} isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the {NAME} until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the {NAME} in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the {NAME} sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: The {NAME} has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The {NAME} has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.description: When the {NAME} is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.
